author: Staff Reporter
text:
Following the announcement of dates for Tamil Nadu assembly elections, Madurai Collector and Election Officer K. Veera Raghava Rao organised a meeting on Saturday with representatives of recognised political parties to formally instruct them on the Model Code of Conduct (MCC), which had come into effect since Friday.

Reiterating the dos and don’ts as per the MCC, the Collector asked the parties to refrain from appealing to voters by invoking caste or religious feelings. He also told the representatives to avoid attacks of all aspects of private life of party leaders or workers.

The Collector warned the political parties of stringent action if they indulged in corrupt practices like distribution of cash or other freebies to secure votes.

Later, Mr. Rao inspected the functioning of flying squads and static surveillance teams, which began their work on Friday, in all the 10 assembly constituencies in the district.

Sources at the Collectorate said that fitting of Global Positioning System (GPS) devices in 60 vehicles allocated for flying squads and static surveillance teams to monitor their movement would begin from Monday.
title: Parties briefed on poll code
